info.description:
============
CORN_COWSAY
============


******
CORN
******
**System information discovery and asset tracking**

INSTALLATION
============



With git::

    git clone https://gitlab.com/saltstack/pop/corn.git
    pip install -e corn

With pip::

    pip install corn_cowsay


EXECUTION
=========
After installation the `corn` command should now be available if it wasn't already


TESTING
=======
install `requirements-test.txt` with pip and run pytest::

    pip install -r corn/requirements-test.txt
    pytest corn/tests

VERTICAL APP-MERGING
====================
Instructions for extending corns like this project does

Install pop::

    pip install --upgrade pop

Create a new directory for the project::

    mkdir corn_{project}
    cd corn_{project}


Use `pop-seed` to generate the structure of a project that extends `corn`::

    pop-seed -t v pop_{kernel} -d corn

* "-t v" specifies that this is a vertically app-merged project
*  "-d corn" says that we want to implement the dynamic name of "corn"

Add "corn" to the requirements.txt::

    echo "corn" >> requirements.txt

Note* url based reqs aren't supported on older versions of setuptools
To pip install your vertically app-merged project install corn manually::

    pip install -e git+https://gitlab.com/saltstack/pop/corn.git#egg=chunkies

And that's it!  Go to town extending corns
Follow the conventions you see in gitlab.com/satlstack/corn
info.name: corn-cowsay
info.summary: Vertically extends the POP-based corn project and adds the cowsay and fortune CORNS
info.html_description:
System information discovery and asset tracking

INSTALLATION

With git:

git clone https://gitlab.com/saltstack/pop/corn.git
pip install -e corn

With pip:

pip install corn_cowsay

EXECUTION

After installation the corn command should now be available if it wasn’t already

TESTING

install requirements-test.txt with pip and run pytest:

pip install -r corn/requirements-test.txt
pytest corn/tests

VERTICAL APP-MERGING

Instructions for extending corns like this project does

Install pop:

pip install --upgrade pop

Create a new directory for the project:

mkdir corn_{project}
cd corn_{project}

Use pop-seed to generate the structure of a project that extends corn:

pop-seed -t v pop_{kernel} -d corn
  • “-t v” specifies that this is a vertically app-merged project
  • “-d corn” says that we want to implement the dynamic name of “corn”

Add “corn” to the requirements.txt:

echo "corn" >> requirements.txt

Note* url based reqs aren’t supported on older versions of setuptools To pip install your vertically app-merged project install corn manually:

pip install -e git+https://gitlab.com/saltstack/pop/corn.git#egg=chunkies

And that’s it! Go to town extending corns Follow the conventions you see in gitlab.com/satlstack/corn
